title: Provides for a plan of expenditure for monies appropriated and received by the state on behalf of a gaming facility located in the city of Buffalo
summary: Provides for a plan of expenditure for monies appropriated and received by the state on behalf of a gaming facility located in the city of Buffalo; provides for the repeal of such provisions on December 31, 2020.

   17  reimbursements or payments to municipal  governments  that  host  tribal

   26  compact; PROVIDED FURTHER THAT FOR ANY GAMING FACILITY  LOCATED  IN  THE
   27  CITY OF BUFFALO, COUNTY OF ERIE, A MINIMUM OF TWENTY-FIVE PERCENT OF THE
   28  NEGOTIATED PERCENTAGE OF THE NET DROP FROM ELECTRONIC GAMING DEVICES THE
   29  STATE  RECEIVES PURSUANT TO THIS COMPACT SHALL BE DISTRIBUTED IN ACCORD-
   30  ANCE WITH SUBDIVISION FIVE OF THIS SECTION; and  provided  further  that
   31  for  any  gaming facility located in the county or counties of Cattarau-
   32  gus, Chautauqua or Allegany, the  municipal  governments  of  the  state
   33  hosting the facility shall collectively receive a minimum of twenty-five
   34  percent  of  the  negotiated  percentage of the net drop from electronic
   35  gaming devices the state receives pursuant to the compact; and  provided
   36  further  that pursuant to chapter five hundred ninety of the laws of two
   37  thousand four, a minimum of twenty-five percent of the revenues received
   38  by the state pursuant to the state's compact with the St.  Regis  Mohawk
   39  tribe  shall  be  made  available  to  the  counties of Franklin and St.
   40  Lawrence, and affected towns in such counties. Each such county and  its
   41  affected  towns shall receive fifty percent of the moneys made available
   42  by the state; and (b) support and services  of  treatment  programs  for
   43  persons  suffering from gambling addictions. Moneys not appropriated for
   44  such purposes shall be transferred to the general fund for  the  support
   45  of government during the fiscal year in which they are received.
   46    S  3. Section 99-h of the state finance law, as amended by chapter 747
   47  of the laws of 2006, is amended by adding a new subdivision 5 to read as
   48  follows:
   49    5. (A) MONIES WHICH ARE APPROPRIATED AND RECEIVED  EACH  YEAR  BY  THE
   50  STATE  AS  A  PORTION  OF THE NEGOTIATED PERCENTAGE OF THE NET DROP FROM
   51  ELECTRONIC GAMING DEVICES THE STATE RECEIVES IN RELATION TO  THE  OPERA-
   52  TION  OF  A GAMING FACILITY IN THE CITY OF BUFFALO, COUNTY OF ERIE WHICH
   53  SUBDIVISION  THREE  OF  THIS  SECTION  REQUIRES  TO  BE  A  MINIMUM   OF
   54  TWENTY-FIVE  PERCENT,  SHALL  BE  BUDGETED  AND DISBURSED TO THE CITY OF
   55  BUFFALO. THE CITY  OF  BUFFALO  SHALL  RETAIN  NINETY-SIX  AND  ONE-HALF
   56  PERCENT  OF  THE  TOTAL ANNUAL AMOUNT RECEIVED AND SHALL AWARD THREE AND

       A. 3318                             3

    1  ONE-HALF PERCENT OF THE TOTAL ANNUAL AMOUNT RECEIVED  TO  AN  ENTITY  OR
    2  ENTITIES  TO  SUPPORT  THE  DEVELOPMENT,  PRESERVATION  AND EXPANSION OF
    3  CULTURAL INSTITUTIONS OR THE DEVELOPMENT  AND  PRESERVATION  OF  TOURISM
    4  RESOURCES,  INCLUDING  MARKETING  AND TOURISM PROMOTION IN THE COUNTY OF
    5  ERIE, INCLUDING IN THE CITY OF BUFFALO. SUCH AWARD OR  AWARDS  SHALL  BE
    6  MADE WITHIN THIRTY-FIVE DAYS OF RECEIPT OF SUCH FUNDS.
    7    (B)  ON  OR  BEFORE  THE  FIRST OF APRIL, EACH ENTITY RECEIVING MONEYS
    8  PURSUANT TO PARAGRAPH (A) OF THIS SUBDIVISION, SHALL ANNUALLY  SUBMIT  A
    9  REPORT  TO  THE  GOVERNOR, TEMPORARY PRESIDENT OF THE SENATE, SPEAKER OF
   10  THE ASSEMBLY, THE ERIE COUNTY EXECUTIVE, CHAIR OF THE ERIE COUNTY LEGIS-
   11  LATURE, MAYOR OF THE CITY OF BUFFALO AND PRESIDENT OF THE COMMON COUNCIL
   12  OF THE CITY OF BUFFALO.  EACH SUCH REPORT SHALL INCLUDE AN ACCOUNTING OF
   13  ALL MONEYS RECEIVED BY SUCH ENTITY PURSUANT TO  PARAGRAPH  (A)  OF  THIS
   14  SUBDIVISION AND THE EXPENDITURE OF ANY SUCH MONEYS.
   15    (C)  NOTWITHSTANDING ANY OTHER PROVISION OF LAW TO THE CONTRARY, FAIL-
   16  URE BY THE CITY OF BUFFALO TO DISBURSE FUNDS AS SUCH  CITY  IS  REQUIRED
   17  PURSUANT TO PARAGRAPH (A) OF THIS SUBDIVISION WITHIN THIRTY-FIVE DAYS OF
   18  THE  ACTUAL  RECEIPT  OF  THE  FUNDS  OR THE SUBMISSION OF THE SUBENTITY
   19  EXPENDITURE REPORT DUE BY APRIL FIRST OF EACH YEAR, WHICHEVER IS  LATER,
   20  SHALL RESULT IN AN ADDITIONAL PAYMENT BY THE CITY OF BUFFALO OF ONE-HALF
   21  PERCENT  PER WEEK NOT TO EXCEED EIGHTEEN PERCENT OF THE AMOUNT WHICH WAS
   22  TO HAVE BEEN DISBURSED PURSUANT TO SUCH PARAGRAPH.  ANY SUCH  ADDITIONAL
   23  PAYMENT  REQUIRED  TO  BE  MADE  BY THE CITY SHALL BE DISBURSED FROM THE
   24  CITY'S SHARE DESCRIBED IN PARAGRAPH (A) OF THIS SUBDIVISION.
   25    (D) IN THE EVENT THAT ANY MONIES TO BE DISTRIBUTED PURSUANT  TO  PARA-
   26  GRAPH  (A)  OF  THIS  SUBDIVISION CANNOT, FOR ANY REASON, BE RECEIVED OR
   27  UTILIZED, SUCH MONIES SHALL BE DISTRIBUTED TO THE CITY  OF  BUFFALO  FOR
   28  ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT PROJECTS WITHIN SUCH CITY.
   29    S 4. This act shall take effect immediately, provided that:
   30    (a)  the  amendments  to  subdivision  3  of section 99-h of the state
   31  finance law made by section one of this act  shall  be  subject  to  the
   32  expiration  and reversion of such section pursuant to section 2 of chap-
   33  ter 747 of the laws of  2006,  as  amended,  when  upon  such  date  the
   34  provisions of section two of this act shall take effect;
   35    (b) the amendments made by section two of this act shall expire Decem-
   36  ber  31,  2020  and  that if chapter 747 of the laws of 2006 is extended
   37  beyond such date, the amendments made by sections one and  two  of  this
   38  act shall expire and be deemed repealed December 31, 2020; and
   39    (c)  section  three  of  this  act shall expire and be deemed repealed
   40  December 31, 2020.
